Posts.Content: KentuckyMom wrote: I'm back home.  Got to stay in hospital for two nights.  Had a reaction to morphine. Crazy nurse didn't record it...another nurse several hrs later came in to give me "pain meds" in my IV...and I was lucky I was awake...she was going to give me morphine!!!   I'm home now and in pain.  The pain meds I have now are ok....but don't seem to take all the pain away.  It's Lortabs.     My underarm hurts worse then my chest.  However after I took a Lortab last night I slept for 6 straight hrs!...so it must work somewhat.  Any suggestions about the underarm pain that helped you guys? Thanks Blessings Jean Jean Samuels Dx 8/2010, Stage IV, mets, ER+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2011 03:04PM KentuckyMom wrote: Elizabeth....ALL of my thoughts and well wishes are with you...hoping you find peace and healing, chocolate and hunky men in your dreams. Hoping you are resing well KNOWING that we all care about YOU. Yes it is hard for those who are not going through this journey to get their tails tied in a knot over things we here on this board take for granted...this openess we have for the facts, good and bad, with the situation we have all found our selves in.  This is a place of safety for us to discussion difficult issues that we maynot be able to with anyone else.  It is also a place for us to be silly sometimes.    This Stage IV thing is something non of us thought we would be in...but what is is what is, not what we wish it to be.  So we stand together, giving each other strenght when we find our selves needing to do a little leaning on someone. I am truely greatful for each and everyone of you on this board. My we keep it up, being a source of strength and care for each other and a place of happiness and joy.     I care about each of you and think of you often. Blessings and Warm Thoughts Jean

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2011 10:20PM KentuckyMom wrote: I don't have lung mets but there are several on here who do and I am sure they'll be along before long to help you out.    I have mets to the bones.  I'm 50ish, married and have five living children.  I had chemo, mastectomy, rads and anti hormon treatment.  I've been doing this since Aug 2010.  I was Stage IV from the get go. I know it sounds really really scary right now but there are things they can do.   I know it's hard to wait, it was for me.   Just know we are all here for you, your mom and dad...you dad can come on here to! Sending you guys my prayers, warm thoughts and hugs Jean

Posts.Content: Jul 6, 2011 09:13AM KentuckyMom wrote: CoolBreeze I hear you and I do understand. I was raised in an Alcoholic home also...it's something that never leaves you. It can however make you a stronger person.  More aware of what is truth and what is denial. I don't like pink either as our color....I want RED!  IMHO it's pink with attitude!!!!! I also try to get my family to face the possibility of the out come of a stage IV DX. laced with humor, yes morbid humor but humor.  I told my youngest son(16) that if I am not here when he is in bootcamp(he wants to be in the military)....when he is lying in his bunk and suddenly everythings falls out of his locker and he gets into trouble with the DI...that is me playing a practical joke on him!   He then told me he will exorcist me...I told him to bring it on!!!   LOL  :D You gotta have humor....cancer itsn't for wimps IMHO  But that's just my weird twisted humor!  :D Hugs and Blessings Jean

Posts.Title: Started on Arimidex..... KentuckyMom justjudie

Posts.Content: Dec 20, 2010 07:42PM KentuckyMom wrote: I never have had any other treatment yet beyound chemo.and zometa and neulasta. I am having a mx the first of the year...one side. So this is my first try at hormone treatment.  Took my first pill today!  Feeling very cranky and snarly.  My oldest darling son(22 yrs old) said, "but mom, you're always cranky and snarly!"  I know who is getting a lump of coal in their stocking!!!!   LOL Blessings Jean
Posts.Title: Started on Arimidex..... KentuckyMom justjudie

Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2010 04:59AM KentuckyMom wrote: The drug store almost made a huge mistake with my prescription. When I went to pick it up they gave me pills that they said were to "prevent blood clots"(blood thinner?).  I told them that that didn't sound right...I told them I was suppose to have an estrogen blocker for my cancer.  They said they would check it out. They called the doctor...and what do you know..I was right!!!!  I bet having this blood thinner in my system would not have been the best idea going into my surgery on Jan 7th huh? Good Grief Blessings Jean
